Subjective: Hard stools for 3 months. Bowel movements every 2-3 days, difficult to pass. Associated abdominal cramps and bloating. Abdomen painful when pressed. Eating habits unchanged (chronically low appetite/eats very little). No recent weight loss, but chronically underweight. Tried olive oil with some effect. No blood in stool. No change in urination. Menstruation regular. Family Hx: Sister with ulcerative colitis, but patient has different symptoms. Request: Wants to know if it's serious and what to do to soften stool.
Objective: Abdomen: Visibly bloated/distended. Auscultation: Normal bowel sounds. Percussion: Varying tympani, dampening in left lower quadrant. Palpation: Soft. No pain in renal lodges, upper abdomen, or right lower quadrant. Tenderness noted in left lower quadrant.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome with constipation (IBS-C). No alarm symptoms.
Plan: 1. Prescribe Psyllium fibre sachets, one daily for 6 weeks. 2. Advice: Take with plenty of water. 3. Safety Net: Contact sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or significant blood appears in stool. 4. Follow-up: Re-evaluate in 6 weeks. 5. Future Plan: Discuss dietitian referral at next appointment.
